# Routes to GPX

> Free tool to convert Google Maps routes and KML files to GPX format for GPS devices

## AI Integration

- OpenAPI Spec: https://routestogpx.com/openapi.json
- ChatGPT Plugin: https://routestogpx.com/.well-known/ai-plugin.json
- MCP Endpoint: https://routestogpx.com/api/mcp
- Agent Card: https://routestogpx.com/.well-known/agent.json

## Primary Function

Convert Google Maps direction URLs and KML files exported from Google My Maps (google.com/maps/d) to GPX format for GPS devices like Garmin, Wahoo, and cycling computers.

## Supported Input Formats

1. **Google Maps Direction URLs**
   - URLs from Google Maps directions (google.com/maps/dir/...)
   - Contains encoded polyline with route coordinates
   - Example: https://www.google.com/maps/dir/40.7128,-74.0060/40.7580,-73.9855/

2. **KML Files from Google My Maps**
   - Export from google.com/maps/d (My Maps)
   - Click three dots menu > Export to KML/KMZ
   - Contains routes, tracks, and waypoints

## Output Format

- GPX 1.1 (GPS Exchange Format)
- Universal standard compatible with all GPS devices
- Contains tracks with coordinates

## API Usage

### Endpoint
POST https://routestogpx.com/api/convert

### Convert Google Maps URL
```json
{
  "type": "url",
  "input": "https://www.google.com/maps/dir/..."
}
```

### Convert KML Content
```json
{
  "type": "kml",
  "input": "<kml xmlns=\"http://www.opengis.net/kml/2.2\">...</kml>"
}
```

### Response
Returns GPX XML string:
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<gpx version="1.1" creator="Routes to GPX">
  <trk>
    <trkseg>
      <trkpt lat="40.7128" lon="-74.0060"/>
      ...
    </trkseg>
  </trk>
</gpx>
```

## Compatible GPS Devices

- Garmin Edge (all models)
- Garmin Forerunner (all models)
- Garmin Fenix (all models)
- Wahoo ELEMNT / ELEMNT BOLT / ELEMNT ROAM
- Hammerhead Karoo
- Komoot
- Strava
- RideWithGPS
- All devices supporting GPX format

## Privacy

- No data collection
- No data storage
- All processing happens client-side in the browser using WebAssembly
- Routes are never uploaded to any server

## How to Use (For Humans)

1. Go to routestogpx.com
2. Either:
   - Paste a Google Maps directions URL and click "Parse URL"
   - Or upload a KML file exported from Google My Maps
3. Preview the route on the map
4. Click "Download GPX"
5. Import the GPX file to your GPS device or app

## Technical Details

- Built with Rust and WebAssembly
- Parses encoded polylines from Google Maps URLs
- Parses KML/XML structure from Google My Maps exports
- Generates valid GPX 1.1 output
- Zero server-side processing
